text: The East Germany women's national football team was in 1990 the women's football team of East Germany. ==History== ==Competitive record== ===European Championship=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" ! colspan="9" | UEFA Women's Championship record |- !Year !Round !Position ! ! ! ! ! ! |- | 1984||colspan="8" rowspan="4"|Did not enter |- | 1987 |- | 1989 |- | 1991 |- !Total||0/4||—||0||0||0||0||0||0 |} ==Squad== None of the capped players went on to represent the Germany national team following reunification. However, Birte Weiß, who was in the squad but did not make an appearance, would go on to be capped twice for Germany. ==Players== Below is a list of the 14 players who were capped for East Germany in their only match. Players in italics were substitutes. None of the players managed to score a goal in the match. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Player ! ! ! class="unsortable" | |- | data-sort-value="Baaske, Katrin" | Katrin Baaske | data-sort-value="4" | FW | 60 | |- | data-sort-value="Berger, Sabine" | Sabine Berger | data-sort-value="4" | FW | 30 | |- | data-sort- value="Brudgam, Sybille" | Sybille Brüdgam | data-sort-value="3" | MF | 90 | |- | data-sort-value="Hecker, Katrin" | Katrin Hecker | data-sort-value="2" | DF | 90 | |- | data-sort-value="Hoffmann, Heike" | Heike Hoffmann | data- sort-value="2" | DF | 90 | |- | data-sort-value="Krumbiegel, Dana" | Dana Krumbiegel | data-sort-value="4" | FW | 90 | |- | data-sort-value="Lange, Sybille" | Sybille Lange | data-sort-value="4" | FW | 90 | |- | data-sort- value="Meier, Doreen" | Doreen Meier | data-sort-value="4" | FW | 90 | |- | data-sort-value="Pruhs, Katrin" | Katrin Prühs | data-sort-value="4" | FW | 90 | |- | data-sort-value="Ulmer, Heike" | Heike Ulmer | data-sort-value="3" | MF | 45 | |- | data-sort-value="Vater, Heidi" | Heidi Vater | data-sort- value="2" | DF | 20 | |- | data-sort-value="Viertel, Anett" | Anett Viertel | data-sort-value="1" | GK | 90 | |- | data-sort-value="Weiss, Carmen" | Carmen Weiß | data-sort-value="3" | MF | 45 | |- | data-sort-value="Weschenfelder, Petra" | Petra Weschenfelder | data-sort-value="2" | DF | 70 | |} ==Coaches== * 1990: Bernd Schröder ==See also== * Women's football in East Germany ==References== ==External links== * MDR gallery on the team Category:Former national association football teams in Europe
title: East Germany women's national football team
